author: iSazonov
body:
1. Add Get-Uptime cmdlet (C# code)
2. Modify psd1 files
3. Add tests

Close #2497 

The PR replace #2507

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@iSazonov**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed the -pretty parameter and agreed that we should use formatting/output to handle that and improve formatting of timespan rather than adding capability into specific cmdlets.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  Thanks for conclusion! I did the fix.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@iSazonov I talked to @Francisco-Gamino offline about the forward link help URI for this `Get-Uptime`. We will request for a `fwlink` internally, and once we get it, will update the code with it. For now, it's OK to leave the `HelpUri` a blank string.

So now the only missing part is the update to `OutputType`. Thanks!

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
OutputType is fixed.
@daxian-dbw thanks for great comments!

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @daxian-dbw Thanks for the review and usefull comments!

title: Add Get-Uptime (C# code)
